noun.description: A piece of land converted from forest to arable use.
examples: an assart cut from the woods a few years back
the Earl of Salisbury was convicted of having assarted 2,300 acres of the parks in 1604

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from Old French essarter, from medieval Latin ex(s)artare, based on ex out + sar(r)ire to weed. The verb dates from the early 16th century.
